> Is there any special reasons that there are no assertNotEquals() methods?

And the answer is.... JUnit-addons :-)

> Now I have to use the assertFalse in order to get the functionality I need.
> 
> assertFalse("Msg", ! obj1.equals( obj2 ) );

I think it's either 'assertTrue(! obj1.equals(obj2))' or
assertFalse(obj1.equals(obj2))'.

-Vladimir
